q: Dallas Mayor Tom repudiates presentation of`` key to the city'' to Michael Vick By Terry Wallace , Associated Press DALLAS- The Mayor Tom of Dallas says he did not sanction giving Philadelphia Eagles quarterback Michael Vick a key to the city. Michael Vick won The Associated Press Comeback Player of the Year award this past season, his second in the NFL since serving 18 months in prison for operating a dogfighting operation. Mayor Tom Pro Tem Dwaine Caraway

Shayne Ward also addressed a report which claimed that he would be href="http://rss.feedsportal.com/music/s103/the-x-factor/news/a292917/Shayne Ward-Shayne Ward-to-be-dropped-by-Simon Cowell.html"> dropped by Simon Cowell 's record label SyCo this year. All's absolutely fine, he said.`` Obviously I had a three-album deal so it's up for negotiation now. Really those rumours are just lazy journalism. It was a three-album deal and we'll negotiate getting the next deal.

Tight end Brent Celek agreed, when he spoke via phone yesterday with a group of reporters from his minivacation getaway in Michigan: Sometimes he's taking some big-time hits, where maybe other guys would get flagged and he's not. Hopefully, they change it. He's a quarterback, too. He's the same as everybody else. Just because he's maybe a little bit more athletic and faster and can run, he shouldn't be penalized. Expect to see more of this sort of lobbying. We're well into the stretch drive and Michael Vick , the most amazing NFL story of 2010, obviously is the key to the Eagles' postseason hopes
